name: Heather's Crawfish Etouffee
author: Heather W.
summary: I am from Louisiana and one of the specialty dishes here is Crawfish Etouffee. This is a simple dish with bold flavor. Enjoy!
ingredients: 1 (10.75 ounce) can  condensed cream of mushroom soup
½ cup water, or as needed
salt and black pepper to taste
directions: Combine the rice and water in a saucepan, and bring to a boil
Cover, and reduce heat to low
Simmer for 15 to 20 minutes, until rice is tender and water has been absorbed
While the rice is cooking, melt the margarine in a large skillet over medium heat
Add the onions and bell pepper, and cook and stir until tender, 10 to 15 minutes
Stir in the garlic, and cook for a minute
Mix in the cream of mushroom soup and water
Season to taste with salt, pepper and cayenne
Cover, reduce heat to low and simmer for 15 to 20 minutes, stirring occasionally
Water can be added to thin as needed
